text: hi guys I'm Laura Vitale and on this
episode of Laura in the kitchen I want
to share with you my take on a super
quick easy vegetable Thai curry now like
I said this is just my take on it by no
means is it authentic Sai no it's not
but it is really really good and it's
really good for you and it comes
together in no time at all the
ingredients you'll need are few you
didn't start off with some vegetables
whatever veggies you like I really enjoy
the combination of asparagus green beans
and cauliflower for this one vegetable
stock some light coconut milk I've also
got onions and garlic and I also have
for topping some cilantro and some limes
and of course you're going to need some
green curry paste and just a little bit
of vegetable oil now I prefer to buy my
curry paste now I know you can make your
own and it's amazing if you can do it
but I'm gonna be very honest with you
eisah live in a small town and a lot of
the ingredients you need to make a curry
paste aren't available to me and you
also need a lot of them and since I
don't make her eat quite often I find
that they can go to waste so what I do
is I just buy it in my grocery store or
you can even order it online and I keep
it in the fridge for a really long time
while you can put it in the freezer that
way anytime I want a little bit of curry
I can just take it right out of the
freezer and I'm good to go so that's
what I would suggest if you don't make

that's what it works for me and my

I'm gonna let this come to a boil reduce

came to a boil
I just reduced the heat down to medium
and let it simmer for 10 minutes and
it's exactly how I want it now I'm gonna
